verses.verse: The burden <S%H4853><s%> which Habakkuk <S%H2265><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%> did see <S%H2372><s%>.
O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, how long shall I cry <S%H7768><s%>, and thou wilt not hear <S%H8085><s%>! even cry out <S%H2199><s%> unto thee of violence <S%H2555><s%>, and thou wilt not save <S%H3467><s%>!

Why dost thou shew <S%H7200><s%> me iniquity <S%H205><s%>, and cause me to behold <S%H5027><s%> grievance <S%H5999><s%>? for spoiling <S%H7701><s%> and violence <S%H2555><s%> are before me: and there are that raise up <S%H5375><s%> strife <S%H7379><s%> and contention <S%H4066><s%>.

Therefore the law <S%H8451><s%> is slacked <S%H6313><s%>, and judgment <S%H4941><s%> doth never <S%H5331><s%> go forth <S%H3318><s%>: for the wicked <S%H7563><s%> doth compass <S%H3803><s%> about the righteous <S%H6662><s%>; therefore wrong <S%H6127><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%> proceedeth <S%H3318><s%>. wrong: or, wrested

Behold <S%H7200><s%> ye among the heathen <S%H1471><s%>, and regard <S%H5027><s%>, and wonder <S%H8539><s%> marvellously <S%H8539><s%>: for I will work <S%H6466><s%> a work <S%H6467><s%> in your days <S%H3117><s%>, which ye will not believe <S%H539><s%>, though it be told <S%H5608><s%> you.

For, lo, I raise up <S%H6965><s%> the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%>, that bitter <S%H4751><s%> and hasty <S%H4116><s%> nation <S%H1471><s%>, which shall march <S%H1980><s%> through the breadth <S%H4800><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>, to possess <S%H3423><s%> the dwellingplaces <S%H4908><s%> that are not theirs. breadth: Heb. breadths

They are terrible <S%H366><s%> and dreadful <S%H3372><s%>: their judgment <S%H4941><s%> and their dignity <S%H7613><s%> shall proceed <S%H3318><s%> of themselves. their judgment: or, from them shall proceed the judgment of these, and the captivity of these

Their horses <S%H5483><s%> also are swifter <S%H7043><s%> than the leopards <S%H5246><s%>, and are more fierce <S%H2300><s%> than the evening <S%H6153><s%> wolves <S%H2061><s%>: and their horsemen <S%H6571><s%> shall spread <S%H6335><s%> themselves, and their horsemen <S%H6571><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> from far <S%H7350><s%>; they shall fly <S%H5774><s%> as the eagle <S%H5404><s%> that hasteth <S%H2363><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%>. fierce: Heb. sharp

They shall come <S%H935><s%> all for violence <S%H2555><s%>: their faces <S%H6440><s%> shall sup up <S%H4041><s%> as the east wind <S%H6921><s%>, and they shall gather <S%H622><s%> the captivity <S%H7628><s%> as the sand <S%H2344><s%>. their: or, the supping up of their faces, etc: or, their faces shall look (Heb. the opposition of their faces) toward the east

And they shall scoff <S%H7046><s%> at the kings <S%H4428><s%>, and the princes <S%H7336><s%> shall be a scorn <S%H4890><s%> unto them: they shall deride <S%H7832><s%> every strong hold <S%H4013><s%>; for they shall heap <S%H6651><s%> dust <S%H6083><s%>, and take <S%H3920><s%> it.
Then shall his mind <S%H7307><s%> change <S%H2498><s%>, and he shall pass over <S%H5674><s%>, and offend <S%H816><s%>, imputing this <S%H2098><s%> his power <S%H3581><s%> unto his god <S%H433><s%>.

Art thou not from everlasting <S%H6924><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%> my God <S%H430><s%>, mine Holy One <S%H6918><s%>? we shall not die <S%H4191><s%>. O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, thou hast ordained <S%H7760><s%> them for judgment <S%H4941><s%>; and, O mighty God <S%H6697><s%>, thou hast established <S%H3245><s%> them for correction <S%H3198><s%>. mighty: Heb. rock. established: Heb. founded

Thou art of purer <S%H2889><s%> eyes <S%H5869><s%> than to behold <S%H7200><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>, and canst <S%H3201><s%> not look <S%H5027><s%> on iniquity <S%H5999><s%>: wherefore lookest <S%H5027><s%> thou upon them that deal treacherously <S%H898><s%>, and holdest thy tongue <S%H2790><s%> when the wicked <S%H7563><s%> devoureth <S%H1104><s%> the man that is more righteous <S%H6662><s%> than he? iniquity: or, grievance
And makest <S%H6213><s%> men <S%H120><s%> as the fishes <S%H1709><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>, as the creeping things <S%H7431><s%>, that have no ruler <S%H4910><s%> over them? creeping: or, moving

They take up <S%H5927><s%> all of them with the angle <S%H2443><s%>, they catch <S%H1641><s%> them in their net <S%H2764><s%>, and gather <S%H622><s%> them in their drag <S%H4365><s%>: therefore they rejoice <S%H8055><s%> and are glad <S%H1523><s%>. drag: or, flue net

Therefore they sacrifice <S%H2076><s%> unto their net <S%H2764><s%>, and burn incense <S%H6999><s%> unto their drag <S%H4365><s%>; because by them <S%H1992><s%> their portion <S%H2506><s%> is fat <S%H8082><s%>, and their meat <S%H3978><s%> plenteous <S%H1277><s%>. plenteous: or, dainty: Heb. fat
Shall they therefore empty <S%H7324><s%> their net <S%H2764><s%>, and not spare <S%H2550><s%> continually <S%H8548><s%> to slay <S%H2026><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%>?
